page.title: 12Shops in Glanaman.
page.content: There has been a decline in the number of shops in Glanaman during recent years. Several former shops are now empty, bearing witness to the fact that most people now prefer to do the bulk of their shopping in the large supermarkets of the nearby towns. There is however, a concentration of small shops selling basic necessities on and around the village square. These include a grocery, a post office, a chemist, a butcher and a bakery. There are also two cafe/fish and chip shops, which are quite popular with the local community. In addition to this nucleus of shops, there are two newsagent/ groceries in the outlying areas of Glanaman, which serve local concentrations of housing.
